description: Generates a comprehensive test coverage report when the coding session ends
author: JSONbored
useCases: Generate final coverage report at session end
Identify untested code areas requiring attention
Track testing progress and coverage improvements
Generate coverage reports for team review
Document testing status for project stakeholders

configuration.scriptContent:
#!/bin/bash

echo "ğŸ§ª Test Coverage Final Report - Analyzing test coverage..."
echo "â° Session ended: $(date)"
echo "â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"

# Detect project type and testing framework
PROJECT_TYPE="unknown"
TEST_FRAMEWORK="unknown"
COVERAGE_AVAILABLE=false

echo "ğŸ” Detecting project type and testing framework..."

# JavaScript/Node.js project detection
if [ -f "package.json" ]; then
    PROJECT_TYPE="node"
    echo "ğŸ“¦ Node.js project detected"
    
    # Detect testing framework
    if grep -q '"jest"' package.json 2>/dev/null; then
        TEST_FRAMEWORK="jest"
        echo "ğŸƒ Jest testing framework detected"
    elif grep -q '"vitest"' package.json 2>/dev/null; then
        TEST_FRAMEWORK="vitest"
        echo "âš¡ Vitest testing framework detected"
    elif grep -q '"mocha"' package.json 2>/dev/null; then
        TEST_FRAMEWORK="mocha"
        echo "â˜• Mocha testing framework detected"
    elif grep -q '"karma"' package.json 2>/dev/null; then
        TEST_FRAMEWORK="karma"
        echo "ğŸ”„ Karma testing framework detected"
    fi
    
# Python project detection
elif [ -f "requirements.txt" ] || [ -f "setup.py" ] || [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    PROJECT_TYPE="python"
    echo "ğŸ Python project detected"
    
    if command -v pytest >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        TEST_FRAMEWORK="pytest"
        echo "ğŸ§ª Pytest testing framework available"
    elif python -c "import unittest" 2>/dev/null; then
        TEST_FRAMEWORK="unittest"
        echo "ğŸ”¬ Unittest framework available"
    fi
    
# Rust project detection
elif [ -f "Cargo.toml" ]; then
    PROJECT_TYPE="rust"
    TEST_FRAMEWORK="cargo"
    echo "ğŸ¦€ Rust project detected"
    
# Go project detection
elif [ -f "go.mod" ]; then
    PROJECT_TYPE="go"
    TEST_FRAMEWORK="go_test"
    echo "ğŸ¹ Go project detected"
    
# Java project detection
elif [ -f "pom.xml" ] || [ -f "build.gradle" ]; then
    PROJECT_TYPE="java"
    echo "â˜• Java project detected"
    
    if [ -f "pom.xml" ]; then
        TEST_FRAMEWORK="maven"
        echo "ğŸ—ï¸ Maven build system detected"
    else
        TEST_FRAMEWORK="gradle"
        echo "ğŸ˜ Gradle build system detected"
    fi
fi

echo ""
echo "ğŸ“Š Running coverage analysis for $PROJECT_TYPE project..."

# Run coverage based on project type
case "$PROJECT_TYPE" in
    "node")
        case "$TEST_FRAMEWORK" in
            "jest")
                echo "ğŸƒ Running Jest with coverage..."
                if npm test -- --coverage --silent 2>/dev/null; then
                    COVERAGE_AVAILABLE=true
                    echo "âœ… Jest coverage completed successfully"
                elif npm run test:coverage 2>/dev/null; then
                    COVERAGE_AVAILABLE=true
                    echo "âœ… Coverage script completed successfully"
                else
                    echo "âš ï¸ Jest coverage command failed - check test configuration"
                fi
                ;;
            "vitest")
                echo "âš¡ Running Vitest with coverage..."
                if npx vitest run --coverage 2>/dev/null; then
                    COVERAGE_AVAILABLE=true
                    echo "âœ… Vitest coverage completed successfully"
                else
                    echo "âš ï¸ Vitest coverage command failed"
                fi
                ;;
            "mocha")
                echo "â˜• Running Mocha with nyc coverage..."
                if npx nyc mocha 2>/dev/null; then
                    COVERAGE_AVAILABLE=true
                    echo "âœ… Mocha coverage completed successfully"
                else
                    echo "âš ï¸ Mocha coverage requires nyc - install with: npm install --save-dev nyc"
                fi
                ;;
            *)
                echo "âš ï¸ No recognized testing framework - attempting generic npm test"
                if npm test 2>/dev/null; then
                    echo "âœ… Tests completed (coverage unknown)"
                else
                    echo "âŒ Tests failed or not configured"
                fi
                ;;
        esac
        ;;
    "python")
        case "$TEST_FRAMEWORK" in
            "pytest")
                echo "ğŸ§ª Running pytest with coverage..."
                if pytest --cov=. --cov-report=term-missing --cov-report=html 2>/dev/null; then
                    COVERAGE_AVAILABLE=true
                    echo "âœ… Pytest coverage completed successfully"
                else
                    echo "âš ï¸ Pytest coverage failed - install with: pip install pytest-cov"
                fi
                ;;
            "unittest")
                echo "ğŸ”¬ Running unittest with coverage..."
                if python -m coverage run -m unittest discover 2>/dev/null; then
                    python -m coverage report 2>/dev/null
                    COVERAGE_AVAILABLE=true
                    echo "âœ… Unittest coverage completed successfully"
                else
                    echo "âš ï¸ Coverage.py not available - install with: pip install coverage"
                fi
                ;;
            *)
                echo "âš ï¸ No Python testing framework detected"
                ;;
        esac
        ;;
    "rust")
        echo "ğŸ¦€ Running Cargo test with coverage..."
        if command -v cargo-tarpaulin >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            if cargo tarpaulin --out Html 2>/dev/null; then
                COVERAGE_AVAILABLE=true
                echo "âœ… Cargo tarpaulin coverage completed successfully"
            else
                echo "âš ï¸ Cargo tarpaulin failed"
            fi
        else
            echo "âš ï¸ cargo-tarpaulin not installed - install with: cargo install cargo-tarpaulin"
            echo "ğŸ”„ Running basic cargo test..."
            cargo test 2>/dev/null && echo "âœ… Tests completed (coverage unavailable)"
        fi
        ;;
    "go")
        echo "ğŸ¹ Running Go test with coverage..."
        if go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./... 2>/dev/null; then
            go tool cover -html=coverage.out -o coverage.html 2>/dev/null
            COVERAGE_AVAILABLE=true
            echo "âœ… Go coverage completed successfully"
        else
            echo "âš ï¸ Go test coverage failed"
        fi
        ;;
    "java")
        case "$TEST_FRAMEWORK" in
            "maven")
                echo "ğŸ—ï¸ Running Maven test with JaCoCo coverage..."
                if mvn test jacoco:report 2>/dev/null; then
                    COVERAGE_AVAILABLE=true
                    echo "âœ… Maven JaCoCo coverage completed successfully"
                else
                    echo "âš ï¸ Maven coverage failed - ensure JaCoCo plugin is configured"
                fi
                ;;
            "gradle")
                echo "ğŸ˜ Running Gradle test with JaCoCo coverage..."
                if ./gradlew test jacocoTestReport 2>/dev/null; then
                    COVERAGE_AVAILABLE=true
                    echo "âœ… Gradle JaCoCo coverage completed successfully"
                else
                    echo "âš ï¸ Gradle coverage failed - ensure JaCoCo plugin is configured"
                fi
                ;;
        esac
        ;;
    *)
        echo "â“ Unknown project type - cannot generate coverage report"
        echo "ğŸ’¡ Supported: Node.js, Python, Rust, Go, Java"
        ;;
esac

echo ""
echo "ğŸ“ˆ Coverage Report Summary:"
echo "â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"

# Display coverage results based on available formats
if [ "$COVERAGE_AVAILABLE" = true ]; then
    case "$PROJECT_TYPE" in
        "node")
            if [ -d "coverage" ]; then
                echo "ğŸ“Š Coverage files found in coverage/ directory"
                
                # Try to parse coverage summary
                if [ -f "coverage/coverage-summary.json" ]; then
                    echo "ğŸ“‹ Coverage Summary:"
                    cat coverage/coverage-summary.json 2>/dev/null | jq -r '.total | "Lines: " + (.lines.pct|tostring) + "% (" + (.lines.covered|tostring) + "/" + (.lines.total|tostring) + ")", "Branches: " + (.branches.pct|tostring) + "% (" + (.branches.covered|tostring) + "/" + (.branches.total|tostring) + ")", "Functions: " + (.functions.pct|tostring) + "% (" + (.functions.covered|tostring) + "/" + (.functions.total|tostring) + ")", "Statements: " + (.statements.pct|tostring) + "% (" + (.statements.covered|tostring) + "/" + (.statements.total|tostring) + ")"' 2>/dev/null || echo "Coverage summary parsing failed"
                fi
                
                echo "ğŸŒ HTML Report: file://$(pwd)/coverage/index.html"
            fi
            ;;
        "python")
            if [ -d "htmlcov" ]; then
                echo "ğŸŒ HTML Report: file://$(pwd)/htmlcov/index.html"
            fi
            ;;
        "rust")
            if [ -f "tarpaulin-report.html" ]; then
                echo "ğŸŒ HTML Report: file://$(pwd)/tarpaulin-report.html"
            fi
            ;;
        "go")
            if [ -f "coverage.html" ]; then
                echo "ğŸŒ HTML Report: file://$(pwd)/coverage.html"
            fi
            ;;
        "java")
            if [ -d "target/site/jacoco" ]; then
                echo "ğŸŒ HTML Report: file://$(pwd)/target/site/jacoco/index.html"
            elif [ -d "build/reports/jacoco/test/html" ]; then
                echo "ğŸŒ HTML Report: file://$(pwd)/build/reports/jacoco/test/html/index.html"
            fi
            ;;
    esac
else
    echo "âŒ No coverage data available"
    echo "ğŸ’¡ Coverage Setup Tips:"
    case "$PROJECT_TYPE" in
        "node")
            echo "  â€¢ For Jest: Add 'collectCoverage: true' to jest.config.js"
            echo "  â€¢ For Vitest: Add 'coverage' provider to vite.config.js"
            echo "  â€¢ Run: npm install --save-dev @vitest/coverage-c8"
            ;;
        "python")
            echo "  â€¢ Install: pip install pytest-cov coverage"
            echo "  â€¢ Run: pytest --cov=your_package"
            ;;
        "rust")
            echo "  â€¢ Install: cargo install cargo-tarpaulin"
            echo "  â€¢ Run: cargo tarpaulin --out Html"
            ;;
        "go")
            echo "  â€¢ Built-in: go test -coverprofile=coverage.out"
            echo "  â€¢ View: go tool cover -html=coverage.out"
            ;;
        "java")
            echo "  â€¢ Add JaCoCo plugin to Maven/Gradle configuration"
            echo "  â€¢ Maven: mvn test jacoco:report"
            echo "  â€¢ Gradle: ./gradlew test jacocoTestReport"
            ;;
    esac
fi

echo ""
echo "ğŸ’¡ Coverage Best Practices:"
echo "  â€¢ Aim for 80%+ line coverage on critical code"
echo "  â€¢ Focus on testing business logic and edge cases"
echo "  â€¢ Use coverage to identify untested code, not as a quality metric"
echo "  â€¢ Write meaningful tests, not just coverage-driven tests"
echo "  â€¢ Exclude generated code and vendor dependencies"
echo "  â€¢ Set up coverage thresholds in CI/CD pipelines"

echo ""
echo "ğŸ¯ Test coverage analysis complete!"
echo "â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"

exit 0
